entries.title: This is a test of modifying the TITLE
entries.whats_new: The AI-powered changelog web application is now complete, automatically summarizing Git commit changes. The API is deployed on Railway, and the front-end on Vercel. Unnecessary code has been cleaned up.
entries.breaking_change: The web app now automatically generates summaries of Git changes, altering previous manual methods, and improving user experience with automation.
entries.impact: Users receive instant, automated changelog summaries for Git repositories, streamlining update tracking.

entries.title: Configuration options for users expanded
entries.whats_new: Users can now configure their own Git repositories, OpenAI LLM settings, and API keys, increasing flexibility.
entries.breaking_change: The system now supports user-defined configurations for repositories and open AI parameters, allowing personalized setup.
entries.impact: Users can tailor the changelog generation to their specific repositories and preferences, making it more versatile.

entries.title: Front-end interface improvements
entries.whats_new: The front-end pages have been decorated and polished, including loading effects, detailed views, and navigation improvements. The changelog detail page now links to specific entries.
entries.breaking_change: The layout now navigates from changelog entries directly to detailed logs, improving user navigation experience.
entries.impact: Users experience a smoother, more informative interface for exploring changelog details.

entries.title: Introduction of cached JSON data for faster loading
entries.whats_new: The back-end now generates a JSON cache file for changelog data. The front-end loads this cache, with layout and icon changes integrated.
entries.breaking_change: The changelog data source shifted to a JSON cache, optimizing load speed and performance.
entries.impact: Users benefit from faster page loads and more responsive navigation through cached changelog data.

entries.title: Initial frontend and backend implementations
entries.whats_new: Basic front-end layout, sidebar, and page structure have been built. Back-end API has been implemented, supporting new commit features like titles, summaries, breaking change detection, and impacts.
entries.impact: Foundation has been laid for a web interface with automated changelog features, improving accessibility.
